content.raw:
I would contend that namespaces reduce complexity by organizing code into clear conceptual units, and that leaving out the namespace will add complexity by forcing us to remember that the `ignition::transport::Log` class is secretly part of a different library than `ignition-transport`.

On the other hand, if the class is named `igition::transport::logging::Log`, then it's easy to recognize that it belongs to the `ignition-transport-logging` library.
